title: Shooting in Lancaster may have been accidental: police
content:
Lancaster police have released more details about a reported shooting that occurred Tuesday evening in the city.
Investigators have recovered the handgun used in the shooting and say the incident may have been accidental based on information gathered. Additionally, the shooting took place on the 300 block of South Broad Street Nov. 29, rather than at South Ann and Dauphin Streets as originally reported, police said.
A 24-year-old man was treated for a gunshot wound to the hand. The injuries were not life-threatening.
No further information was available at the time of this post.
Police continue to investigate the shooting. Anyone with information about the incident is asked to call 717-735-3300; call Lancaster City-County Crime Stoppers at 1-800-322-1913; submit a tip button on the Lancaster police website; or text a tip to Crime Stoppers by texting LANCS plus your message to 847411.
